title: General Motors Brands Typefaces
content: What are the fonts used for General Motors' various brands?
author: HSR Classic

comments.content:

IMHO... Maybe, you need be more specific... ;D

Okay... off the top of my head I can think of the fonts for Buick and Pontiac. The current font they use isn't just custom lettering for their logo. I've actually seen it in use in a magazine ad from a few years back. See [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215120750/http:/www.chromespinners.com/images/buick_logo.gif) image. As for Pontiac, it's the font they use for their [Grand Prix](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215120750/http:/www.usatf.org/events/2001/USAIndoorChampionships/images/indoorChamp01.jpg). I'm sure there's a freeware version of this out there.

OK - here are the images.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215120750im_/http:/typophile.com/files/buick_logo_4477.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215120750im_/http:/typophile.com/files/indoorChamp01_6592.jpg)
  
(I'm interested in the official font used for "Grand Prix")

‘BUICK’ looks a lot like [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215120750/http:/typophile.com/node/12967) and modified (‘U’) [Delta Jaeger](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215120750/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/delta-be/book/).

In the the GrandPrix, Sofachrome from Larabie!

It's is free ;D See here:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/sofachrome/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215120750/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/sofachrome/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/sofachrome/")

I'll have to find which magazine had the Buick ad that used that font and see if I can scan it. I'm certain it's not a modified Delta for a logotype, because the ad uses this custom font. Fabio, I have seen Larabie's font, however I doubt General Motors would use it. If anything, they probably use a font of their own. I've seen commercials with this font, and a Pontiac brochure used it as well.
I found the ad, and I guess it does use Berthold Delta. Thanks for your help.

I work on GM Canada.

Buick = Delta - but you've got an old logo there. They just released a new one.  
Chevrolet = Klavika  
Pontiac = Univers - I'm not sure what the States does but in Canada we use Univers  
GMC = Aachen - ugh.  
Hummer = Franklin Gothic  
Cadillac = Franklin Gothic or Delta - I don't remember as I don't really do much Cadillac stuff  
Saturn = Univers  
Goodwrench = Myriad  
General Corporate = TheSans or GMSans as it's labeled on my computer. Probably a custom version.

ok, so i just started working for GM, i'm a designer, but working in R&D at the tech center. all the original signage around the place has this futura-ish typeface that's really nice, but i can't find any documentation about it. it may just be a pre-digital futura, or something original for the tech center when it was made. I don't have any good pictures of it yet, as cameras are technically not allowed in the building.

it's really gorgeous type, and most of it is falling apart, which is real shame
